smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'AppModule' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'NotificationService' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'ComposeStatusController' with '15' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Interface 'Listener' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside interfaces is set to '11'
Class 'SettingViewModel' with '12' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Object 'null' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside objects is set to '11'
Class 'SettingDataManagerImpl' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Interface 'SettingDataManager' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside interfaces is set to '11'

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function calculateDiff appears to be too complex.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface Listener is too complex. Consider splitting it up.
The interface SettingDataManager is too complex. Consider splitting it up.
The interface UserComponent is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function provideSettingViewModel has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function update has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: StringLiteralDuplication
smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

instances.message: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.
Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

instances.message: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: EmptyClassBlock
smells.description: Empty block of code detected. As they serve no purpose they should be removed.

instances.message: The class or object  AppGlideModule is empty.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionCaught
smells.description: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

instances.message: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

smells.name: FunctionMaxLength
smells.description: Function names should not be longer than the maximum set in the project configuration.

instances.message: Function names should be at most 30 characters long.
Function names should be at most 30 characters long.
Function names should be at most 30 characters long.
Function names should be at most 30 characters long.

smells.name: VariableNaming
smells.description: Variable names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Variable names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: ConstructorParameterNaming
smells.description: Constructor parameter names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Constructor parameter names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: MatchingDeclarationName
smells.description: If a source file contains only a single non-private top-level class or object, the file name should reflect the case-sensitive name plus the .kt extension.

instances.message: The file name 'RxExtensions.kt' does not match the name of the single top-level declaration 'SkipUntilCompletedConsumer'.

smells.name: FunctionMinLength
smells.description: Function names should not be shorter than the minimum defined in the configuration.

instances.message: Function names should be at least 3 characters long.
Function names should be at least 3 characters long.

smells.name: SpreadOperator
smells.description: Using a spread operator causes a full copy of the array to be created before calling a method has a very high performance penalty.

instances.message: Using a spread operator causes a full copy of the array to be created before calling a method has a very high performance penalty.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: android.view.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
net.yslibrary.monotweety.base.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.transition.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
com.bluelinelabs.conductor.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: ReturnCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of return statements in methods.

instances.message: Function areItemsTheSame has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function areContentsTheSame has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `it to newList`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `app to it`

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.
An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.
An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.
An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.

smells.name: UnusedImports
smells.description: Unused Imports are dead code and should be removed.

instances.message: The import 'net.yslibrary.monotweety.base.di.UserScope' is unused.
The import 'net.yslibrary.monotweety.base.di.UserScope' is unused.
The import 'io.reactivex.Observable' is unused.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in ((parent as HasComponent<Any>).component as PROVIDER) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: (parent as HasComponent<Any>).component as PROVIDER

smells.name: OptionalUnit
smells.description: Return type of 'Unit' is unnecessary and can be safely removed.

instances.message: The function emit defines a return type of Unit. This is unnecessary and can safely be removed.
